nodes.name: project
nodes.description: Any specifically defined piece of work that is undertaken or attempted to meet a single requirement. (NCIt C47885)

properties.name: availability_type
properties.description: Is the project open or restricted?

properties.name: awg_review
properties.description: Indicates that the project is an AWG project.

properties.name: code
properties.description: Project code

properties.name: dbgap_accession_number
properties.description: The dbgap accession number for the project.

properties.name: disease_type
properties.description: Full name for the project

properties.name: intended_release_date
properties.description: Tracks a Project's intended release date.

properties.name: in_review
properties.description: Indicates that the project is under review by the submitter. Upload and data modification is disabled.

properties.name: is_legacy
properties.description: Indicates whether a project will appear in the Legacy Archive.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Display name for the project

properties.name: primary_site
properties.description: Primary site for the project

properties.name: release_requested
properties.description: User requests that the GDC release the project. Release can only be requested if the project is releasable.

properties.name: released
properties.description: To release a project is to tell the GDC to include all submitted entities in the next GDC index.

properties.name: releasable
properties.description: A project can only be released by the user when `releasable` is true.

properties.name: request_submission
properties.description: Indicates that the user has requested submission to the GDC for harmonization.

properties.name: submission_enabled
properties.description: Indicates if submission to a project is allowed.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'project' table.

nodes.name: case
nodes.description: The collection of all data related to a specific subject in the context of a specific project.

properties.name: consent_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of consent obtain from the subject for participation in the study.

properties.name: days_to_consent
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the subject consent was obtained for participation in the study.

properties.name: days_to_lost_to_followup
properties.description: The number of days between the date used for index and to the date the patient was lost to follow-up.

properties.name: disease_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of malignant disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).

properties.name: index_date
properties.description: The text term used to describe the reference or anchor date used when for date obfuscation, where a single date is obscurred by creating one or more date ranges in relation to this date.

properties.name: lost_to_followup
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether a patient was unable to be contacted or seen for follow-up information.

properties.name: primary_site
properties.description: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories. Reference tissue_or_organ_of_origin on the diagnosis node for more specific primary sites of disease.

properties.name: project.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'project' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'case' table.

properties.name: batch_id
properties.description: GDC submission batch indicator. It is unique within the context of a project.

properties.name: case.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'case' table.

nodes.name: clinical_supplement
nodes.description: Data file containing clinical metadata information.

properties.name: data_category
properties.description: Broad categorization of the contents of the data file.

properties.name: data_type
properties.description: Specific content type of the data file.

properties.name: data_format
properties.description: Format of the data files.

properties.name: case.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'case' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'clinical_supplement' table.

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: The size of the data file (object) in bytes.

properties.name: md5sum
properties.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number (in lower case) used as a file's digital fingerprint.

properties.name: object_id
properties.description: The GUID of the object in the index service.

properties.name: batch_id
properties.description: GDC submission batch indicator. It is unique within the context of a project.

properties.name: clinical_supplement.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'clinical_supplement' table.

nodes.name: demographic
nodes.description: Data for the characterization of the patient by means of segmenting the population (e.g., characterization by age, sex, or race).

properties.name: age_at_index
properties.description: The patient's age (in years) on the reference or anchor date used during date obfuscation.

properties.name: age_is_obfuscated
properties.description: The age or other properties related to the patient's age have been modified for compliance reasons. The actual age may differ from what was reported in order to comply with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).

properties.name: cause_of_death
properties.description: Text term to identify the cause of death for a patient.

properties.name: cause_of_death_source
properties.description: The text term used to describe the source used to determine the patient's cause of death.

properties.name: country_of_birth
properties.description: The name of the country in which the patient is born.

properties.name: country_of_residence_at_enrollment
properties.description: The text term used to describe the patient's country of residence at the time they were enrolled in the study.

properties.name: days_to_birth
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a person's date of birth represented as a calculated negative number of days.

properties.name: days_to_death
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date from a person's date of death represented as a calculated number of days.

properties.name: education_level
properties.description: The years of schooling completed in graded public, private, or parochial schools, and in colleges, universities, or professional schools.

properties.name: ethnicity
properties.description: An individual's self-described social and cultural grouping, specifically whether an individual describes themselves as Hispanic or Latino. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

properties.name: gender
properties.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. [Explanatory Comment 1: Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire, interview, etc.]

properties.name: marital_status
properties.description: A demographic parameter indicating a person's current conjugal status.

properties.name: occupation_duration_years
properties.description: The number of years a patient worked in a specific occupation.

properties.name: population_group
properties.description: A group of individuals united by a common factor (e.g., geographic location, ethnicity, disease, age, gender).

properties.name: premature_at_birth
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient was premature (less than 37 weeks gestation) at birth.

properties.name: race
properties.description: An arbitrary classification of a taxonomic group that is a division of a species. It usually arises as a consequence of geographical isolation within a species and is characterized by shared heredity, physical attributes and behavior, and in the case of humans, by common history, nationality, or geographic distribution. The provided values are based on the categories defined by the U.S. Office of Management and Business and used by the U.S. Census Bureau.

properties.name: vital_status
properties.description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol.

properties.name: weeks_gestation_at_birth
properties.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of weeks starting from the approximate date of the biological mother's last menstrual period and ending with the birth of the patient.

properties.name: year_of_birth
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the calendar year in which an individual was born.

properties.name: year_of_death
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the year of the death of an individual.

properties.name: case.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'case' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'demographic' table.

properties.name: batch_id
properties.description: GDC submission batch indicator. It is unique within the context of a project.

properties.name: demographic.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'demographic' table.

properties.name: data_category
properties.description: Broad categorization of the contents of the data file.

properties.name: data_type
properties.description: Specific content type of the data file.

properties.name: data_format
properties.description: Format of the data files.

properties.name: case.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'case' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'biospecimen_supplement' table.

properties.name: file_name
properties.description: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).

properties.name: file_size
properties.description: The size of the data file (object) in bytes.

properties.name: md5sum
properties.description: The 128-bit hash value expressed as a 32 digit hexadecimal number (in lower case) used as a file's digital fingerprint.

properties.name: object_id
properties.description: The GUID of the object in the index service.

properties.name: batch_id
properties.description: GDC submission batch indicator. It is unique within the context of a project.

properties.name: biospecimen_supplement.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'biospecimen_supplement' table.

nodes.name: clinical
nodes.description: Data obtained through patient examination or treatment. (GDC synonym for NCIt C15783)

properties.name: age_at_diagnosis
properties.description: Age in days at which a condition or disease was first diagnosed. CDE: 3225640. TCGA has the age in years with CDE 2006657, this is converted by ceil(age*365.25) to get days.

properties.name: days_to_death
properties.description: Time interval from a person's date of death to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days. CDE: 3165475.

properties.name: gender
properties.description: Text designations that identify gender. Gender is described as the assemblage of properties that distinguish people on the basis of their societal roles. CDE: 2200604

properties.name: ethnicity
properties.description: The text for reporting information about ethnicity based on the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) categories. CDE: 2192217.

properties.name: icd_10
properties.description: The tenth version of the International Classification of Disease (ICD), published by the World Health Organization in 1992. A system of numbered categories for representation of data. CDE: 3226287.

properties.name: race
properties.description: The text for reporting information about race based on the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) categories. CDE: 2192199.

properties.name: vital_status
properties.description: The survival state of the person registered on the protocol. CDE: 5.

properties.name: year_of_diagnosis
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the year of an individual's initial pathologic diagnosis of cancer. CDE: 2896960.

properties.name: case.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'case' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'clinical' table.

properties.name: batch_id
properties.description: GDC submission batch indicator. It is unique within the context of a project.

properties.name: clinical.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'clinical' table.

nodes.name: exposure
nodes.description: Clinically relevant patient information not immediately resulting from genetic predispositions.

properties.name: age_at_last_exposure
properties.description: The study participant's age at the time they were last exposed.

properties.name: age_at_onset
properties.description: Numeric value used to represent the age of the patient when exposure to a specific environmental factor began.

properties.name: alcohol_days_per_week
properties.description: Numeric value used to describe the average number of days each week that a person consumes an alcoholic beverage.

properties.name: alcohol_drinks_per_day
properties.description: Numeric value used to describe the average number of alcoholic beverages a person consumes per day.

properties.name: alcohol_frequency
properties.description: Describes how often the subject drinks alcohol.

properties.name: alcohol_history
properties.description: A response to a question that asks whether the participant has consumed at least 12 drinks of any kind of alcoholic beverage in their lifetime.

properties.name: alcohol_intensity
properties.description: Category to describe the patient's current level of alcohol use as self-reported by the patient.

properties.name: alcohol_type
properties.description: A specific type of alcohol.

properties.name: asbestos_exposure
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient was exposed to asbestos.

properties.name: asbestos_exposure_type
properties.description: The type of asbestos exposure the study participant experienced.

properties.name: chemical_exposure_type
properties.description: The specific type of contact with a chemical substance through touch, inhalation, or ingestion.

properties.name: cigarettes_per_day
properties.description: The average number of cigarettes smoked per day.

properties.name: coal_dust_exposure
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether a patient was exposed to fine powder derived by the crushing of coal.

properties.name: environmental_tobacco_smoke_exposure
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether a patient was exposed to smoke that is emitted from burning tobacco, including cigarettes, pipes, and cigars. This includes tobacco smoke exhaled by smokers.

properties.name: exposure_duration
properties.description: Text term used to describe the length of time the patient was exposed to an environmental factor.

properties.name: exposure_duration_hrs_per_day
properties.description: The duration (in hours per day) that a person was exposed.

properties.name: exposure_duration_years
properties.description: The period of time from start to finish of exposure, in years.

properties.name: exposure_source
properties.description: The source or location where the patient was exposed.

properties.name: exposure_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of environmental exposure.

properties.name: occupation_duration_years
properties.description: The number of years a patient worked in a specific occupation.

properties.name: occupation_type
properties.description: A categorization of the principal activity that a person does to earn money, as defined by the International Classification of Occupation (ISCO).

properties.name: pack_years_smoked
properties.description: Numeric computed value to represent lifetime tobacco exposure defined as number of cigarettes smoked per day x number of years smoked divided by 20.

properties.name: parent_with_radiation_exposure
properties.description: Indicates whether the patient's parent(s) were exposed to radiation

properties.name: radon_exposure
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient was exposed to radon.

properties.name: respirable_crystalline_silica_exposure
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether a patient was exposed to respirable crystalline silica, a widespread, naturally occurring, crystalline metal oxide that consists of different forms including quartz, cristobalite, tridymite, tripoli, ganister, chert, and novaculite.

properties.name: secondhand_smoke_as_child
properties.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient was exposed to secondhand smoke as a child.

properties.name: smoking_frequency
properties.description: The text term used to generally describe how often the patient smokes.

properties.name: time_between_waking_and_first_smoke
properties.description: The text term used to describe the approximate amount of time elapsed between the time the patient wakes up in the morning to the time they smoke their first cigarette.

properties.name: tobacco_smoking_onset_year
properties.description: The year in which the participant began smoking.

properties.name: tobacco_smoking_quit_year
properties.description: The year in which the participant quit smoking.

properties.name: tobacco_smoking_status
properties.description: Category describing current smoking status and smoking history as self-reported by a patient.

properties.name: type_of_smoke_exposure
properties.description: The text term used to describe the patient's specific type of smoke exposure.

properties.name: type_of_tobacco_used
properties.description: The text term used to describe the specific type of tobacco used by the patient.

properties.name: use_per_day
properties.description: The average number of times the patient used per day.

properties.name: years_smoked
properties.description: Numeric value (or unknown) to represent the number of years a person has been smoking.

properties.name: case.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'case' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'exposure' table.

properties.name: batch_id
properties.description: GDC submission batch indicator. It is unique within the context of a project.

properties.name: exposure.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'exposure' table.

nodes.name: family_history
nodes.description: Record of a patient's background regarding cancer events of blood relatives.

properties.name: relationship_age_at_diagnosis
properties.description: The age (in years) when the patient's relative was first diagnosed.

properties.name: relationship_gender
properties.description: The text term used to describe the gender of the patient's relative with a history of cancer.

properties.name: relationship_primary_diagnosis
properties.description: The text term used to describe the malignant diagnosis of the patient's relative with a history of cancer.

properties.name: relationship_type
properties.description: The subgroup that describes the state of connectedness between members of the unit of society organized around kinship ties.

properties.name: relative_deceased
properties.description: The historical fact that a legal or consanguineous family member has died.

properties.name: relative_smoker
properties.description: Indication that a legal or consanguineous family member was a smoker.

properties.name: relative_with_cancer_history
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether any of the patient's relatives have a history of cancer.

properties.name: relatives_with_cancer_history_count
properties.description: The number of relatives the patient has with a known history of cancer.

properties.name: case.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'case' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'family_history' table.

properties.name: batch_id
properties.description: GDC submission batch indicator. It is unique within the context of a project.

properties.name: family_history.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'family_history' table.

nodes.name: diagnosis
nodes.description: Data from the investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

properties.name: adrenal_hormone
properties.description: Indicates the presence of the adrenal hormone. The adrenal hormone is made from cholesterol and protein produced by the adrenal glands and regulate electrolyte balance, blood pressure, inflammation, blood sugar balance, and immune system control.

properties.name: age_at_diagnosis
properties.description: Age at the time of diagnosis expressed in number of days since birth.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_m
properties.description: Extent of the distant metastasis for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_n
properties.description: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_stage
properties.description: Stage group determined from clinical information on the tumor (T), regional node (N) and metastases (M) and by grouping cases with similar prognosis for cancer.

properties.name: ajcc_clinical_t
properties.description: Extent of the primary cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_m
properties.description: Code to represent the defined absence or presence of distant spread or metastases (M) to locations via vascular channels or lymphatics beyond the regional lymph nodes, using criteria established by the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_n
properties.description: The codes that represent the stage of cancer based on the nodes present (N stage) according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_stage
properties.description: The extent of a cancer, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body based on AJCC staging criteria.

properties.name: ajcc_pathologic_t
properties.description: Code of pathological T (primary tumor) to define the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumor (T), using staging criteria from the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC).

properties.name: ajcc_serum_tumor_markers
properties.description: A laboratory test result in which markers for testicular cancer are tested in a blood sample for staging purposes.

properties.name: ajcc_staging_system_edition
properties.description: The text term used to describe the version or edition of the American Joint Committee on Cancer Staging Handbooks, a publication by the group formed for the purpose of developing a system of staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.

properties.name: ann_arbor_b_symptoms
properties.description: Text term to signify whether lymphoma B-symptoms are present as noted in the patient's medical record.

properties.name: ann_arbor_b_symptoms_described
properties.description: Text describing the specific lymphoma B-symptoms present.

properties.name: ann_arbor_clinical_stage
properties.description: The text term used to describe the clinical classification of lymphoma, as defined by the Ann Arbor Lymphoma Staging System.

properties.name: ann_arbor_extranodal_involvement
properties.description: Indicator that identifies whether a patient with malignant lymphoma has lymphomatous involvement of an extranodal site.

properties.name: ann_arbor_pathologic_stage
properties.description: The text term used to describe the pathologic classification of lymphoma, as defined by the Ann Arbor Lymphoma Staging System.

properties.name: best_overall_response
properties.description: The best improvement achieved throughout the entire course of protocol treatment.

properties.name: burkitt_lymphoma_clinical_variant
properties.description: Burkitt's lymphoma categorization based on clinical features that differ from other forms of the same disease.

properties.name: calgb_risk_group
properties.description: A classification strategy for Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML) developed by the cancer research cooperative group Cancer And Leukemia Group B that assigns a rating based on the cytogenetic and molecular features of a particular disease.

properties.name: cancer_detection_method
properties.description: The method used to detect disease.

properties.name: child_pugh_classification
properties.description: The text term used to describe the classification used in the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis.

properties.name: clark_level
properties.description: A morphologic finding indicating the cutaneous melanoma depth of invasion into the dermis and subcutaneous tissue.

properties.name: classification_of_tumor
properties.description: Text that describes the kind of disease present in the tumor specimen as related to a specific timepoint.

properties.name: cog_liver_stage
properties.description: The text term used to describe the staging classification of liver tumors, as defined by the Children's Oncology Group (COG). This staging system specifically describes the extent of the primary tumor prior to treatment.

properties.name: cog_neuroblastoma_risk_group
properties.description: Text term that represents the categorization of patients on the basis of prognostic factors per a system developed by Children's Oncology Group (COG). Risk level is used to assign treatment intensity.

properties.name: cog_renal_stage
properties.description: The text term used to describe the staging classification of renal tumors, as defined by the Children's Oncology Group (COG).

properties.name: cog_rhabdomyosarcoma_risk_group
properties.description: Text term used to describe the classification of rhabdomyosarcoma, as defined by the Children's Oncology Group (COG).

properties.name: contiguous_organ_invaded
properties.description: The organ or contiguous site the disease migrated to from the primary site.

properties.name: days_to_best_overall_response
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient was thought to have the best overall response to their disease.

properties.name: days_to_diagnosis
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was diagnosed with the malignant disease.

properties.name: days_to_last_follow_up
properties.description: Time interval from the date of last follow up to the date of initial pathologic diagnosis, represented as a calculated number of days.

properties.name: days_to_last_known_disease_status
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient's disease status was known.

properties.name: days_to_recurrence
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient's disease recurred.

properties.name: diagnosis_is_primary_disease
properties.description: Indicates whether this specific diagnosis represents the disease that was the primary focus of the study. Additionally, this diagnosis is reflected at the case level, which is captured using the case.disease_type property.

properties.name: double_expressor_lymphoma
properties.description: An immunohistochemical finding indicating the presence of double expression of MYC and BCL2 proteins in the neoplastic cells of a tumor sample.

properties.name: double_hit_lymphoma
properties.description: A rare B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma that is characterized by the abnormal rearrangement of two genes, MYC gene and either BCL2 or BCL6 genes. Patients with this type of lymphoma usually respond poorly to standard treatments and have a poor prognosis.

properties.name: eln_risk_classification
properties.description: A recommended risk stratification system used to provide prognostic information in AML patients undergoing chemotherapy as well as allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.

properties.name: enneking_msts_grade
properties.description: The text term used to describe the surgical grade of the musculoskeletal sarcoma, using the Enneking staging system approved by the Musculoskeletal Tumor Society (MSTS).

properties.name: enneking_msts_metastasis
properties.description: Text term and code that represents the metastatic stage of the musculoskeletal sarcoma, using the Enneking staging system approved by the Musculoskeletal Tumor Society (MSTS).

properties.name: enneking_msts_stage
properties.description: Text term used to describe the stage of the musculoskeletal sarcoma, using the Enneking staging system approved by the Musculoskeletal Tumor Society (MSTS).

properties.name: enneking_msts_tumor_site
properties.description: Text term and code that represents the tumor site of the musculoskeletal sarcoma, using the Enneking staging system approved by the Musculoskeletal Tumor Society (MSTS).

properties.name: ensat_clinical_m
properties.description: A clinical finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the ENSAT staging v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.

properties.name: ensat_pathologic_n
properties.description: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the ENSAT staging v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the lymph nodes.

properties.name: ensat_pathologic_stage
properties.description: An adrenal cancer stage defined according to the European Network for the Study of Adrenal Tumors (ENSAT) criteria.

properties.name: ensat_pathologic_t
properties.description: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of adrenal cancer, following the rules of the ENSAT staging v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor.

properties.name: esophageal_columnar_dysplasia_degree
properties.description: Text term to describe the amount of dysplasia found within the benign esophageal columnar mucosa.

properties.name: esophageal_columnar_metaplasia_present
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether esophageal columnar metaplasia was determined to be present.

properties.name: fab_morphology_code
properties.description: A classification system for acute myeloid leukemias, acute lymphoblastic leukemias, and myelodysplastic syndromes. It is based on the morphologic and cytochemical evaluation of bone marrow and peripheral blood smears.

properties.name: figo_stage
properties.description: The extent of a cervical or endometrial cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body, as described by the International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) stages.

properties.name: figo_staging_edition_year
properties.description: The text term used to describe the edition year of the FIGO staging system used to stage the patient's gynecologic tumor.

properties.name: first_symptom_longest_duration
properties.description: The length of time the first presenting symptom occurred that related to the diagnosis of the patient with cancer.

properties.name: first_symptom_prior_to_diagnosis
properties.description: Text term used to describe the patient's first symptom experienced prior to diagnosis and thought to be related to the disease.

properties.name: gastric_esophageal_junction_involvement
properties.description: The yes o/unknown ot reported indicator used to describe whether the tumor is located across the gastroesophageal junction.

properties.name: gleason_grade_group
properties.description: The text term used to describe the overall grouping of grades defined by the Gleason grading classification, which is used to determine the aggressiveness of prostate cancer. Note that this grade describes the entire prostatectomy specimen and is not specific to the sample used for sequencing.

properties.name: gleason_grade_tertiary
properties.description: The text term used to describe the tertiary pattern as described by the Gleason Grading System.

properties.name: gleason_patterns_percent
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the percentage of Patterns 4 and 5, which is used when the Gleason score is greater than 7 to predict prognosis.

properties.name: gleason_score
properties.description: The score derived from universally embraced prostate cancer grading system developed by Dr. Donald F. Gleason in 1977. The system provides a reproducible description of the glandular architecture of prostate tissue to which a pathologist assigns a score depending primarily on the microscopic patterns of cancerous glands and cell morphology

properties.name: goblet_cells_columnar_mucosa_present
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether goblet cells were determined to be present in the esophageal columnar mucosa.

properties.name: icd_10_code
properties.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the disease code from the tenth version of the International Classification of Disease (ICD-10).

properties.name: igcccg_stage
properties.description: The text term used to describe the International Germ Cell Cancer Collaborative Group (IGCCCG), a grouping used to further classify metastatic testicular tumors.

properties.name: inpc_grade
properties.description: Text term used to describe the classification of neuroblastic differentiation within neuroblastoma tumors, as defined by the International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification (INPC).

properties.name: inpc_histologic_group
properties.description: The text term used to describe the classification of neuroblastomas distinguishing between favorable and unfavorable histologic groups. The histologic score, defined by the International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification (INPC), is based on age, mitosis-karyorrhexis index (MKI), stromal content and degree of tumor cell differentiation.

properties.name: inrg_stage
properties.description: The text term used to describe the staging classification of neuroblastic tumors, as defined by the International Neuroblastoma Risk Group (INRG).

properties.name: inss_stage
properties.description: Text term used to describe the staging classification of neuroblastic tumors, as defined by the International Neuroblastoma Staging System (INSS).

properties.name: international_prognostic_index
properties.description: The text term used to describe the International Prognostic Index, which classifies the prognosis of patients with aggressive non-Hodgkin's lymphoma.

properties.name: irs_group
properties.description: Text term used to describe the classification of rhabdomyosarcoma tumors, as defined by the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study (IRS).

properties.name: irs_stage
properties.description: The text term used to describe the classification of rhabdomyosarcoma tumors, as defined by the Intergroup Rhabdomyosarcoma Study (IRS).

properties.name: ishak_fibrosis_score
properties.description: The text term used to describe the classification of the histopathologic degree of liver damage.

properties.name: iss_stage
properties.description: The multiple myeloma disease stage at diagnosis.

properties.name: last_known_disease_status
properties.description: Text term that describes the last known state or condition of an individual's neoplasm.

properties.name: laterality
properties.description: For tumors in paired organs, designates the side on which the cancer originates.

properties.name: margin_distance
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the distance between the tumor and the surgical margin

properties.name: margins_involved_site
properties.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic sites that were involved in the survival margins.

properties.name: masaoka_stage
properties.description: The text term used to describe the Masaoka staging system, a classification that defines prognostic indicators for thymic malignancies and predicts tumor recurrence.

properties.name: max_tumor_bulk_site
properties.description: The site of the tumor where the dimension or diameter is larger than any other part of the tumor.

properties.name: medulloblastoma_molecular_classification
properties.description: The text term used to describe the classification of medulloblastoma tumors based on molecular features.

properties.name: melanoma_known_primary
properties.description: A melanoma which has metastasized from a known primary anatomic site.

properties.name: metastasis_at_diagnosis
properties.description: The text term used to describe the extent of metastatic disease present at diagnosis.

properties.name: metastasis_at_diagnosis_site
properties.description: Text term to identify an anatomic site in which metastatic disease involvement is found.

properties.name: method_of_diagnosis
properties.description: Text term used to describe the method used to confirm the patients malignant diagnosis.

properties.name: micropapillary_features
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether micropapillary features were determined to be present.

properties.name: mitosis_karyorrhexis_index
properties.description: Text term that represents the component of the International Neuroblastoma Pathology Classification (INPC) for mitosis-karyorrhexis index (MKI).

properties.name: mitotic_count
properties.description: The number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors. The method of counting varies, according to the specific tumor examined. Usually, the mitotic count is determined based on the number of mitoses per high power field (40X) or 10 high power fields.

properties.name: morphology
properties.description: The third edition of the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, published in 2000 used principally in tumor and cancer registries for coding the site (topography) and the histology (morphology) of neoplasms. The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs. In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains. A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

properties.name: ovarian_specimen_status
properties.description: The text term used to describe the physical condition of the involved ovary.

properties.name: ovarian_surface_involvement
properties.description: The text term that describes whether the surface tissue (outer boundary) of the ovary shows evidence of involvement or presence of cancer.

properties.name: papillary_renal_cell_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of papillary renal cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of papillae covered by small cells with scant amount of cytoplasm.

properties.name: pediatric_kidney_staging
properties.description: A modified version of the Children's Oncology Group (COG) National Wilms Tumor Study Group (NWTS) staging system.

properties.name: peritoneal_fluid_cytological_status
properties.description: The text term used to describe the malignant status of the peritoneal fluid determined by cytologic testing.

properties.name: pregnant_at_diagnosis
properties.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient was pregnant at the time they were diagnosed.

properties.name: primary_diagnosis
properties.description: Text term used to describe the patient's histologic diagnosis, as described by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).

properties.name: primary_disease
properties.description: Indicates whether the specific diagnosis represents the disease that was the primary focus of the study.

properties.name: primary_gleason_grade
properties.description: The text term used to describe the primary Gleason score, which describes the pattern of cells making up the largest area of the tumor. The primary and secondary Gleason pattern grades are combined to determine the patient's Gleason grade group, which is used to determine the aggresiveness of prostate cancer. Note that this grade describes the entire prostatectomy specimen and is not specific to the sample used for sequencing.

properties.name: prior_malignancy
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe the patient's history of prior cancer diagnosis.

properties.name: prior_treatment
properties.description: A yes o/unknown ot applicable indicator related to the administration of therapeutic agents received before the body specimen was collected.

properties.name: progression_or_recurrence
properties.description: Indicates whether a patient has a progression or recurrence after initial treatment. This can include local, regional, or metastatic disease.

properties.name: residual_disease
properties.description: Tumor cells that remain in the body following cancer treatment.

properties.name: satellite_nodule_present
properties.description: Indicator noting whether a nodule or tumor is located within a small distance (e.g. 2cm) of the primary tumor.

properties.name: secondary_gleason_grade
properties.description: The text term used to describe the secondary Gleason score, which describes the pattern of cells making up the second largest area of the tumor. The primary and secondary Gleason pattern grades are combined to determine the patient's Gleason grade group, which is used to determine the aggresiveness of prostate cancer. Note that this grade describes the entire prostatectomy specimen and is not specific to the sample used for sequencing.

properties.name: site_of_resection_or_biopsy
properties.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of origin, of the patient's malignant disease, as described by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).

properties.name: sites_of_involvement
properties.description: The anatomic sites of disease involvement in addition to the primary anatomic site.

properties.name: sites_of_involvement_count
properties.description: The number of anatomic sites of disease.

properties.name: supratentorial_localization
properties.description: Text term to specify the location of the supratentorial tumor.

properties.name: synchronous_malignancy
properties.description: A yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient had an additional malignant diagnosis at the same time the tumor used for sequencing was diagnosed. If both tumors were sequenced, both tumors would have synchronous malignancies.

properties.name: tissue_or_organ_of_origin
properties.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of origin, of the patient's malignant disease, as described by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O).

properties.name: tumor_burden
properties.description: Refers to the number of cancer cells, the size of a tumor, or the amount of cancer in the body.

properties.name: tumor_confined_to_organ_of_origin
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether the tumor is confined to the organ where it originated and did not spread to a proximal or distant location within the body.

properties.name: tumor_depth
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the depth of tumor invasion, measured in millimeters (mm).

properties.name: tumor_focality
properties.description: The text term used to describe whether the patient's disease originated in a single location or multiple locations.

properties.name: tumor_grade
properties.description: Numeric value to express the degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation and aggressiveness.

properties.name: tumor_grade_category
properties.description: Describes the number of levels or 'tiers' in the system used to determine the degree of tumor differentiation.

properties.name: tumor_of_origin
properties.description: The submitter_id string of the primary diagnosis node.

properties.name: tumor_regression_grade
properties.description: A numeric value used to measure therapeutic response of the primary tumor and predict patient outcomes based on a three-point tumor regression grading system.

properties.name: uicc_clinical_m
properties.description: The UICC TNM Classification is an anatomically based system that records the primary and regional nodal extent of the tumor and the absence or presence of metastases. The clinical M category describes the presence or otherwise of distant metastatic spread as determined during a clinical exam.

properties.name: uicc_clinical_n
properties.description: The UICC TNM Classification is an anatomically based system that records the primary and regional nodal extent of the tumor and the absence or presence of metastases. The clinical N category describes the regional lymph node involvement as determined during a clinical exam.

properties.name: uicc_clinical_stage
properties.description: The UICC TNM Classification is an anatomically based system that records the primary and regional nodal extent of the tumor and the absence or presence of metastases. The clinical stage is based on the T, N, and M categories which are determined during a clinical exam.

properties.name: uicc_clinical_t
properties.description: The UICC TNM Classification is an anatomically based system that records the primary and regional nodal extent of the tumor and the absence or presence of metastases. The clinical T category describes the primary tumor site and size as determined during a clinical exam.

properties.name: uicc_pathologic_m
properties.description: The UICC TNM Classification is an anatomically based system that records the primary and regional nodal extent of the tumor and the absence or presence of metastases. The pathological M category describes the presence or otherwise of distant metastatic spread as determined during a pathology review.

properties.name: uicc_pathologic_n
properties.description: The UICC TNM Classification is an anatomically based system that records the primary and regional nodal extent of the tumor and the absence or presence of metastases. The pathological N category describes the regional lymph node involvement as determined during a pathology review.

properties.name: uicc_pathologic_stage
properties.description: The UICC TNM Classification is an anatomically based system that records the primary and regional nodal extent of the tumor and the absence or presence of metastases. The pathological stage is based on the T, N, and M categories which are determined during a pathological review.

properties.name: uicc_pathologic_t
properties.description: The UICC TNM Classification is an anatomically based system that records the primary and regional nodal extent of the tumor and the absence or presence of metastases. The pathological T category describes the primary tumor site and size as determined during a pathology review.

properties.name: uicc_staging_system_edition
properties.description: The UICC TNM Classification is an anatomically based system that records the primary and regional nodal extent of the tumor and the absence or presence of metastases. The staging edition describes the specific UICC edition used when a patient's stage was determined.

properties.name: ulceration_indicator
properties.description: The formation or development of an ulcer.

properties.name: weiss_assessment_findings
properties.description: Histopathologic criteria to evaluate adrenocortical tumors.

properties.name: weiss_assessment_score
properties.description: The text term used to describe the overall Weiss assessment score, a commonly used assessment describing the malignancy of adrenocortical tumors. The Weiss score is determined based on nine histological criteria including the following: high nuclear grade, mitotic rate greater than five per 50 high power fields (HPF), atypical mitotic figures, eosinophilic tumor cell cytoplasm (greater than 75% tumor cells), diffuse architecture (greater than 33% of tumor), necrosis, venous invasion, sinusoidal invasion, and capsular invasion.

properties.name: who_cns_grade
properties.description: The WHO (World Health Organization) grading classification of CNS tumors, which is based on histological characteristics such as cellularity, mitotic activity, pleomorphism, necrosis, and endothelial proliferation (neoangiogenesis).

properties.name: who_nte_grade
properties.description: The WHO (World Health Organization) grading classification of Neuroendocrine Tumors.

properties.name: wilms_tumor_histologic_subtype
properties.description: The text term used to describe the classification of Wilms tumors distinguishing between favorable and unfavorable histologic groups.

properties.name: year_of_diagnosis
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the year of an individual's initial pathologic diagnosis of cancer.

properties.name: case.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'case' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'diagnosis' table.

properties.name: batch_id
properties.description: GDC submission batch indicator. It is unique within the context of a project.

properties.name: diagnosis.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'diagnosis' table.

nodes.name: follow_up
nodes.description: A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional. A clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures and assessments that may be performed on a subject. A visit has a start and an end, each described with a rule. The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained before and after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

properties.name: adverse_event
properties.description: Text that represents the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events low level term name for an adverse event.

properties.name: adverse_event_grade
properties.description: Numeric representation of the intensity/severity of an unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite).

properties.name: aids_risk_factors
properties.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor of the acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) that the patient either had at the time of the study or experienced in the past.

properties.name: barretts_esophagus_goblet_cells_present
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether goblet cells were determined to be present in a patient diagnosed with Barrett's esophagus.

properties.name: bmi
properties.description: A calculated numerical quantity that represents an individual's weight to height ratio.

properties.name: body_surface_area
properties.description: Numeric value used to represent the two-dimensional extent of the body surface relating height to weight.

properties.name: cause_of_response
properties.description: The text term used to describe the suspected cause or reason for the patient disease response.

properties.name: cd4_count
properties.description: The text term used to describe the outcome of the procedure to determine the amount of the CD4 expressing cells in a sample.

properties.name: cdc_hiv_risk_factors
properties.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor for human immunodeficiency virus, as described by the Centers for Disease Control.

properties.name: comorbidities
properties.description: The text term used to describe a patient with one or more diseases or conditions, which coexist with the patient's malignant disease at the same time.

properties.name: comorbidity
properties.description: The text term used to describe a comorbidity disease, which coexists with the patient's malignant disease.

properties.name: comorbidity_method_of_diagnosis
properties.description: The text term used to describe the method used to diagnose the patient's comorbid disease.

properties.name: days_to_adverse_event
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient's adverse event.

properties.name: days_to_comorbidity
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was diagnosed with a comorbidity.

properties.name: days_to_first_event
properties.description: The number of days from the index date to the date of the first event.

properties.name: days_to_follow_up
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the patient's last follow-up appointment or contact.

properties.name: days_to_imaging
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the imaging or scan was performed on the patient.

properties.name: days_to_progression
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient's disease progressed.

properties.name: days_to_progression_free
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient's disease was formally confirmed as progression-free.

properties.name: days_to_recurrence
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient's disease recurred.

properties.name: days_to_risk_factor
properties.description: The number of days from the index date to the date the patient was diagnosed with a specific risk factor.

properties.name: diabetes_treatment_type
properties.description: Text term used to describe the types of treatment used to manage diabetes.

properties.name: discontiguous_lesion_count
properties.description: The number of the discontiguous lesions in a new tumor event.

properties.name: disease_response
properties.description: Code assigned to describe the patient's response or outcome to the disease.

properties.name: dlco_ref_predictive_percent
properties.description: The value, as a percentage of predicted lung volume, measuring the amount of carbon monoxide detected in a patient's lungs.

properties.name: ecog_performance_status
properties.description: The ECOG functional performance status of the patient/participant.

properties.name: evidence_of_progression_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of evidence used to determine whether the patient's disease progressed.

properties.name: evidence_of_recurrence_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of evidence used to determine whether the patient's disease recurred.

properties.name: eye_color
properties.description: The color of the iris of the eye

properties.name: fev1_fvc_post_bronch_percent
properties.description: Percentage value to represent result of Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) divided by the Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) post-bronchodilator.

properties.name: fev1_fvc_pre_bronch_percent
properties.description: Percentage value to represent result of Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) divided by the Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) pre-bronchodilator.

properties.name: fev1_ref_post_bronch_percent
properties.description: The percentage comparison to a normal value reference range of the volume of air that a patient can forcibly exhale from the lungs in one second post-bronchodilator.

properties.name: fev1_ref_pre_bronch_percent
properties.description: The percentage comparison to a normal value reference range of the volume of air that a patient can forcibly exhale from the lungs in one second pre-bronchodilator.

properties.name: first_event
properties.description: Describes the patient's first event after initial treatment.

properties.name: haart_treatment_indicator
properties.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient received Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy (HAART).

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the patient in centimeters.

properties.name: hepatitis_sustained_virological_response
properties.description: An indication as to whether sustained virological response was obtained in responses to viral hepatitis treatment.

properties.name: histologic_progression
properties.description: The evolution of a low-grade neoplastic pathologic process to a high grade malignancy.

properties.name: history_of_tumor
properties.description: Indicates whether patient has a history of tumors.

properties.name: history_of_tumor_type
properties.description: Describes the type of the patient's prior diagnosed tumor.

properties.name: hiv_viral_load
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the concentration of an analyte or aliquot extracted from the sample or sample portion, measured in milligrams per milliliter.

properties.name: hormonal_contraceptive_type
properties.description: The specific type of hormonal contraceptives used by the subject.

properties.name: hormonal_contraceptive_use
properties.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient used hormonal contraceptives.

properties.name: hormone_replacement_therapy_type
properties.description: The specific type of hormone replacement therapy received by the patient.

properties.name: hpv_positive_type
properties.description: Text classification to represent the strain or type of human papillomavirus identified in an individual.

properties.name: hysterectomy_margins_involved
properties.description: The text term used to indicate whether the patient's disease was determined to be involved based on the surgical margins of the hysterectomy.

properties.name: hysterectomy_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of hysterectomy the patient had.

properties.name: imaging_anatomic_site
properties.description: The named location(s) within the body where an image was taken.

properties.name: imaging_findings
properties.description: Recorded findings noted during the review of a specific medical image.

properties.name: imaging_result
properties.description: The text term used to describe the result of the imaging or scan performed on the patient.

properties.name: imaging_suv
properties.description: The standardized update value (SUV) is the effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) / [injected dose (nCi) / body weight (g)].

properties.name: imaging_suv_max
properties.description: The standardized update value (SUV) is the effectively dimensionless measure of regional tracer uptake calculated as the activity concentration within a 2D region of interest (ROI) or 3D volume of interest (VOI) measured on a PET image (nCi1mL) / [injected dose (nCi) / body weight (g)]. Specifically, the maximum SUV recorded for a patient.

properties.name: imaging_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of imaging or scan performed on the patient.

properties.name: immunosuppressive_treatment_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of immunosuppressive treatment the patient received.

properties.name: karnofsky_performance_status
properties.description: Text term used to describe the classification used of the functional capabilities of a person.

properties.name: menopause_status
properties.description: Text term used to describe the patient's menopause status.

properties.name: nadir_cd4_count
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the lowest point to which the CD4 count has dropped (nadir).

properties.name: pancreatitis_onset_year
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the year that the patient was diagnosed with clinical chronic pancreatitis.

properties.name: peritoneal_washing_results
properties.description: The results from this minimally invasive procedure that permits sampling of peritoneal fluid for cytopathologic analysis.

properties.name: pregnancy_count
properties.description: The number of times an individual has become pregnant.

properties.name: pregnancy_outcome
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of pregnancy the patient had.

properties.name: procedures_performed
properties.description: The type of procedures performed on the patient.

properties.name: progression_or_recurrence
properties.description: Indicates whether a patient has a progression or recurrence after initial treatment. This can include local, regional, or metastatic disease.

properties.name: progression_or_recurrence_anatomic_site
properties.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of the progressive or recurrent disease.

properties.name: progression_or_recurrence_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of progressive or recurrent disease or relapsed disease.

properties.name: recist_targeted_regions_number
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the number of baseline target lesions, as described by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) criteria.

properties.name: recist_targeted_regions_sum
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the sum of baseline target lesions, as described by the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST) criteria.

properties.name: reflux_treatment_type
properties.description: Text term used to describe the types of treatment used to manage gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).

properties.name: risk_factor
properties.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor the patient had at the time of or prior to their diagnosis.

properties.name: risk_factor_method_of_diagnosis
properties.description: The clinical or laboratory procedure(s) used in the determination of a diagnosis described in this context as a risk factor.

properties.name: risk_factor_treatment
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether the patient received treatment for a risk factor the patient had at the time of or prior to their diagnosis.

properties.name: risk_factors
properties.description: The text term used to describe a risk factor the patient had at the time of or prior to their diagnosis.

properties.name: scan_tracer_used
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of tracer used during the imaging or scan of the patient.

properties.name: timepoint_category
properties.description: Category describing a specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

properties.name: treatment_emergent_adverse_event
properties.description: A situation that emerges during treatment, having been absent pretreatment, or worsens relative to the pretreatment state.

properties.name: undescended_testis_corrected
properties.description: Indicates whether the patient's undescended testis was corrected.

properties.name: undescended_testis_corrected_age
properties.description: The patient's age when their undescended testis was corrected.

properties.name: undescended_testis_corrected_laterality
properties.description: Describes the lateral location of the patient's undescended testis correction.

properties.name: undescended_testis_corrected_method
properties.description: Describes the method used to correct the patient's undescended testis.

properties.name: undescended_testis_history
properties.description: The persistent failure of one or both testes to descend into the scrotum.

properties.name: undescended_testis_history_laterality
properties.description: Describes the lateral location of the patient's undescended testis.

properties.name: viral_hepatitis_serologies
properties.description: Text term that describes the kind of serological laboratory test used to determine the patient's hepatitis status.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: The weight of the patient measured in kilograms.

properties.name: year_of_follow_up
properties.description: The year of the patient's last follow-up appointment or contact.

properties.name: case.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'case' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'follow_up' table.

properties.name: diagnosis.id
properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'diagnosis' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'follow_up' table.

properties.name: batch_id
properties.description: GDC submission batch indicator. It is unique within the context of a project.

properties.name: follow_up.id
properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'follow_up' table.

nodes.name: sample
nodes.description: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

properties.name: biospecimen_anatomic_site
properties.description: Text term that represents the name of the organ or tissue site of the submitted sample.

properties.name: biospecimen_laterality
properties.description: For tumors in paired organs, designates the side on which the specimen was obtained.

properties.name: catalog_reference
properties.description: HCMI catalog reference number for cancer model.

properties.name: composition
properties.description: Text term that represents the cellular composition of the sample.

properties.name: current_weight
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the current weight of the sample, measured in milligrams.

properties.name: days_to_collection
properties.description: The number of days from the index date to the date a sample was received by the Biospecimen Core Resource (BCR) or other center for processing.

properties.name: days_to_sample_procurement
properties.description: The number of days from the index date to the date a patient underwent a procedure (e.g. surgical resection) to yield or remove from the patient a sample that was eventually used for research.

properties.name: diagnosis_pathologically_confirmed
properties.description: The histologic description of tissue or cells confirmed by a pathology review of frozen or formalin fixed slide(s) completed after the diagnostic pathology review of the tumor sample used to extract analyte(s).

properties.name: distance_normal_to_tumor
properties.description: Text term to signify the distance between the tumor tissue and the normal control tissue that was procured for matching normal DNA.

properties.name: distributor_reference
properties.description: Distributor reference number for cancer model.

properties.name: freezing_method
properties.description: Text term that represents the method used for freezing the sample.

properties.name: growth_rate
properties.description: Rate at which the model grows, measured as hours to time to split.

properties.name: initial_weight
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the initial weight of the sample, measured in milligrams.

properties.name: intermediate_dimension
properties.description: Intermediate dimension of the sample, in millimeters.

properties.name: is_ffpe
properties.description: Indicator to signify whether or not the tissue sample was fixed in formalin and embedded in paraffin (FFPE).

properties.name: longest_dimension
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the longest dimension of the sample, measured in millimeters.

properties.name: method_of_sample_procurement
properties.description: The method used to procure the sample used to extract analyte(s).

properties.name: oct_embedded
properties.description: Indicator of whether or not the sample was embedded in Optimal Cutting Temperature (OCT) compound.

properties.name: passage_count
properties.description: Number of passages (splits) between the original tissue and this model.

properties.name: pathology_report_uuid
properties.description: UUID of the related pathology report.

properties.name: preservation_method
properties.description: Text term that represents the method used to preserve the sample.

properties.name: sample_ordinal
properties.description: A number describing the samples place in an ordered sequence.

properties.name: sample_type
properties.description: Text term to describe the source of a biospecimen used for a laboratory test.

properties.name: sample_type_id
properties.description: The accompanying sample type id for the sample type.

properties.name: shortest_dimension
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the shortest dimension of the sample, measured in millimeters.

properties.name: specimen_type
properties.description: The type of a material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes. This includes particular types of cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory substances.

properties.name: time_between_clamping_and_freezing
properties.description: Numeric representation of the elapsed time between the surgical clamping of blood supply and freezing of the sample, measured in minutes.

properties.name: time_between_excision_and_freezing
properties.description: Numeric representation of the elapsed time between the excision and freezing of the sample, measured in minutes.

properties.name: tissue_collection_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of collection used to obtain tissue.

properties.name: tissue_type
properties.description: Text term that represents a description of the kind of tissue collected with respect to disease status or proximity to tumor tissue.

properties.name: tumor_code
properties.description: Diagnostic tumor code of the tissue sample source.

properties.name: tumor_code_id

properties.name: course_number

properties.name: drug_category
properties.description: A broad categorization of the type of drug administered.

properties.name: embolic_agent

properties.description: The text term used to describe the status of the patient's malignancy when the treatment began.

properties.name: lesions_treated_number

properties.name: margin_distance

properties.name: margin_status
properties.description: The determination of the presence of actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient.

properties.name: margins_involved_site
properties.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic sites that were involved in the survival margins.

properties.name: number_of_cycles
properties.description: The numeric value used to describe the number of cycles of a specific treatment or regimen the patient received.

properties.name: number_of_fractions

properties.description: A quantity of an agent prescribed to the study participant.

properties.name: prescribed_dose_units

properties.name: reason_treatment_not_given

properties.name: regimen_or_line_of_therapy

properties.name: residual_disease

properties.name: route_of_administration
properties.description: The pathway by which a substance is administered in order to reach the site of action in the body.

properties.name: therapeutic_level_achieved

properties.name: therapeutic_target_level

properties.name: treatment_dose_max

properties.name: treatment_dose_units

properties.name: treatment_duration

properties.name: treatment_effect_indicator

properties.name: treatment_frequency

properties.name: treatment_outcome

properties.name: additional_pathology_findings
