properties.description: Yes o/unknown ot reported indicator used to describe whether anaplasia was present at the time of diagnosis.

properties.name: anaplasia_present_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the morphologic findings indicating the presence of a malignant cellular infiltrate characterized by the presence of large pleomorphic cells, necrosis, and high mitotic activity in a tissue sample.

properties.name: bone_marrow_malignant_cells
properties.description: The text term used to indicate whether there are malignant cells in the bone marrow.

properties.name: breslow_thickness
properties.description: The number that describes the distance, in millimeters, between the upper layer of the epidermis and the deepest point of tumor penetration.

properties.name: circumferential_resection_margin
properties.description: Numeric value used to describe the non-peritonealised bare area of rectum, comprising anterior and posterior segments, when submitted as a surgical specimen resulting from excision of cancer of the rectum.

properties.name: columnar_mucosa_present
properties.description: Indicator noting whether columnar mucosa was present within the tissue.

properties.name: consistent_pathology_review
properties.description: Indicates whether a recent review of tissue is consistent with a prior pathology review.

properties.name: days_to_pathology_detail
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date a pathologic review of a specific sample or slide was performed.

properties.name: dysplasia_degree
properties.description: The degree to which dysplasia was involved.

properties.name: dysplasia_type
properties.description: The type of dysplasia involved.

properties.name: epithelioid_cell_percent
properties.description: A quantitative measurement of the percent of epithelioid melanocytes compared to the number of total cells present in a sample.

properties.name: epithelioid_cell_percent_range
properties.description: A quantitative measurement of the percent of epithelioid melanocytes compared to the number of total cells present in a sample.

properties.name: extracapsular_extension
properties.description: The extension of malignant tissue situated outside of a specific capsule.

properties.name: extranodal_extension
properties.description: Extension of a malignant neoplasm beyond the lymph node capsule.

properties.name: extraocular_nodule_size
properties.description: The size of the nodule that is outside the eye.

properties.name: extrascleral_extension
properties.description: Spread of uveal melanoma beyond the sclera.

properties.name: extrascleral_extension_present
properties.description: Spread of uveal melanoma beyond the sclera.

properties.name: extrathyroid_extension
properties.description: Text term to describe the degree to which the primary tumor has extra thyroid extension.

properties.name: greatest_tumor_dimension
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the measurement of the widest portion of the tumor in centimeters.

properties.name: gross_tumor_weight
properties.description: Numeric value used to describe the gross pathologic tumor weight, measured in grams.

properties.name: histologic_progression_type
properties.description: Text term to describe the disease progression as determined by microscopic review of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.

properties.name: intratubular_germ_cell_neoplasia_present
properties.description: Text term to indicate whether the intratubular germ cell neoplasm is present or absent.

properties.name: largest_extrapelvic_peritoneal_focus
properties.description: The text term used to describe the diameter of the largest focus originating outside of the pelvic peritoneal region.

properties.name: lymph_node_dissection_method
properties.description: The method employed to remove a lymph nodes(s)

properties.name: lymph_node_dissection_site
properties.description: The named location(s) within the body where a lymph node(s) were removed.

properties.name: lymph_node_involved_site
properties.description: The text term used to describe the anatomic site of lymph node involvement.

properties.name: lymph_node_involvement
properties.description: Indicator noting whether lymph nodes were involved.

properties.name: lymph_nodes_positive
properties.description: The number of lymph nodes involved with disease as determined by pathologic examination.

properties.name: lymph_nodes_removed
properties.description: The number of lymph nodes removed during a biopsy or surgical procedure.

properties.name: lymph_nodes_tested
properties.description: The number of lymph nodes tested to determine whether lymph nodes were involved with disease as determined by a pathologic examination.

properties.name: lymphatic_invasion_present
properties.description: A yes o indicator to ask if small or thin-walled vessel invasion is present, indicating lymphatic involvement

properties.name: margin_status
properties.description: The determination of the presence of actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient.

properties.name: measurement_type
properties.description: The method used to measure tumor size.

properties.name: measurement_unit
properties.description: The type of unit of measure being used to express a length or distance.

properties.name: metaplasia_present
properties.description: Indicator noting whether metaplasia was present.

properties.name: micrometastasis_present
properties.description: Indication of metastasis in the form of small clusters of malignant cells identifiable only under the microscope.

properties.name: morphologic_architectural_pattern
properties.description: A specific morphologic or pathologic architectural pattern was discovered within the sample studied.

properties.name: necrosis_percent
properties.description: A quantitative measurement of the percent of cells undergoing necrosis compared to the number of total cells present in a sample.

properties.name: necrosis_present
properties.description: Indicator describing whether the presence of necrosis was confirmed.

properties.name: non_nodal_regional_disease
properties.description: The text term used to describe whether the patient had non-nodal regional disease.

properties.name: non_nodal_tumor_deposits
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe the presence of tumor deposits in the pericolic or perirectal fat or in adjacent mesentery away from the leading edge of the tumor.

properties.name: number_proliferating_cells
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the sample slide(s).

properties.name: percent_tumor_invasion
properties.description: The percentage of tumor cells spread locally in a malignant neoplasm through infiltration or destruction of adjacent tissue.

properties.name: percent_tumor_nuclei
properties.description: Numeric value to represent the percentage of tumor nuclei in a malignant neoplasm sample or specimen.

properties.name: perineural_invasion_present
properties.description: a yes o indicator to ask if perineural invasion or infiltration of tumor or cancer is present.

properties.name: peripancreatic_lymph_nodes_positive
properties.description: Enumerated numeric value or range of values used to describe the number of peripancreatic lymph nodes determined to be positive.

properties.name: peripancreatic_lymph_nodes_tested
properties.description: The total number of peripancreatic lymph nodes tested for the presence of pancreatic cancer cells.

properties.name: prcc_type
properties.description: The type of papillary renal cell carcinoma. It is classified as type 1 or 2, based on the cytoplasmic volume and the thickness of the lining neoplastic cells.

properties.name: prostatic_chips_positive_count
properties.description: The text term used to describe the number of positive prostatic chips, which are generated from transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP) procedures and are generally used for relieving urinary obstruction due to nodular hyperplasia of the prostate (benign prostatic hyperplasia).

properties.name: prostatic_chips_total_count
properties.description: The text term used to describe the total number of prostatic chips, which are generated from transurethral resection of the prostate (TURP) procedures and are generally used for relieving urinary obstruction due to nodular hyperplasia of the prostate (benign prostatic hyperplasia).

properties.name: prostatic_involvement_percent
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the percentage of prostatic involvement found in a specific tissue sample.

properties.name: residual_tumor
properties.description: Tumor cells that remain in the body following cancer treatment.

properties.name: residual_tumor_measurement
properties.description: A measurement of the tumor cells that remain in the body following cancer treatment.

properties.name: rhabdoid_percent
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the percentage of rhabdoid features found in a specific tissue sample.

properties.name: rhabdoid_present
properties.description: Indicator describing whether rhabdoid features were present.

properties.name: sarcomatoid_percent
properties.description: Numeric value that represents the percentage of sarcomatoid features found in a specific tissue sample.

properties.name: sarcomatoid_present
properties.description: Indicator describing whether sarcomatoid features were present.

properties.name: size_extraocular_nodule
properties.description: The size of the nodule that is outside the eye.

properties.name: spindle_cell_percent
properties.description: A quantitative measurement of the percent of spindle-shaped melanocytes compared to the number of total cells present in a sample.

properties.name: spindle_cell_percent_range
properties.description: A quantitative measurement of the percent of spindle-shaped melanocytes compared to the number of total cells present in a sample.

properties.name: timepoint_category
properties.description: Category describing a specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

properties.name: transglottic_extension
properties.description: The text term used to describe an extension of the tumor beyond the opening into the ventricles and vocal cords.

properties.name: tumor_basal_diameter
properties.description: Numeric value in millimeters for the lowest layer of a tumor.

properties.name: tumor_burden

properties.name: tumor_depth_descriptor
properties.description: Text term for the degree to which a tumor has penetrated into organ or tissue.

properties.name: tumor_depth_measurement
properties.description: The numerical measurement of tumor depth.

properties.name: tumor_infiltrating_lymphocytes
properties.description: Lymphocytes that show specificity for autologous tumor cells and can infiltrate a tumor.

properties.name: tumor_infiltrating_macrophages
properties.description: Non-neoplastic macrophages that infiltrate a tumor.

properties.name: tumor_largest_dimension_diameter
properties.description: Numeric value used to describe the maximum diameter or dimension of the primary tumor, measured in centimeters.

properties.name: tumor_length_measurement
properties.description: The numerical measurement of tumor length.

properties.name: tumor_level_prostate
properties.description: The level(s) of the prostate from which the tumor originated.

properties.name: tumor_shape
properties.description: Text term to represent the description of the shape of a tumor determined by clinical or pathological techniques.

properties.name: tumor_thickness
properties.description: A measurement of the thickness of a sectioned slice (of tissue or mineral or other substance) in millimeters (mm).

properties.name: tumor_width_measurement
properties.description: The numerical measurement of tumor width.

properties.name: vascular_invasion_present
properties.description: The yes o indicator to ask if large vessel or venous invasion was detected by surgery or presence in a tumor specimen.

properties.name: vascular_invasion_type
properties.description: Text term that represents the type of vascular tumor invasion.

properties.name: zone_of_origin_prostate
properties.description: The location or position of the tumor by zone of the prostate.

properties.description: Numeric value used to represent the two-dimensional extent of the body surface relating height to weight.

properties.name: percent_inflam_infiltration

nodes.name: molecular_test
nodes.description: Information pertaining to any molecular tests performed on the patient during a clinical event.

properties.name: aa_change
properties.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the amino acid change for a specific genetic variant. Example: R116Q.

properties.name: aneuploidy
properties.description: A chromosomal abnormality in which there is an addition or loss of chromosomes within a set (e.g., 23 + 22 or 23 + 24).

properties.name: antigen
properties.description: The text term used to describe an antigen included in molecular testing.

properties.name: biospecimen_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the biological material used for testing, diagnostic, treatment or research purposes.

properties.name: biospecimen_volume
properties.description: The volume of the biospecimen.

properties.name: blood_test_normal_range_lower
properties.description: Numeric value used to describe the lower limit of the normal range used to describe a healthy individual at the institution where the test was completed.

properties.name: blood_test_normal_range_upper
properties.description: Numeric value used to describe the upper limit of the normal range used to describe a healthy individual at the institution where the test was completed.

properties.name: cell_count
properties.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of cells used for molecular testing.

properties.name: chromosomal_translocation
properties.description: A genetic exchange where a piece of one chromosome is transferred to another chromosome.

properties.name: chromosome
properties.description: The text term used to describe a chromosome targeted or included in molecular testing. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the chromosome where that variant is located.

properties.name: chromosome_arm
properties.description: Under the microscope chromosomes appear as thin, thread-like structures. They all have a short arm and long arm separated by a primary constriction called the centromere. The short arm is designated as p and the long arm as q.

properties.name: clonality
properties.description: The text term used to describe whether a genomic variant is related by descent from a single progenitor cell.

properties.name: copy_number
properties.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of times a section of the genome is repeated or copied within an insertion, duplication or deletion variant.

properties.name: cytoband
properties.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the cytoband or chromosomal location targeted or included in molecular analysis. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the cytoband where the variant is located. Format: [chromosome][chromosome arm].[band+sub-bands]. Example: 17p13.1.

properties.name: days_to_test
properties.description: Number of days between the date used for index and the date of the laboratory test.

properties.name: exon
properties.description: Exon number targeted or included in a molecular analysis. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the exon where that variant is located.

properties.name: gene_symbol
properties.description: The text term used to describe a gene targeted or included in molecular analysis. For rearrangements, this should be used to represent the reference gene.

properties.name: histone_family
properties.description: The text term used to describe the family, or classification of a group of basic proteins found in chromatin, called histones.

properties.name: histone_variant
properties.description: The text term used to describe a specific histone variants, which are proteins that substitute for the core canonical histones.

properties.name: hpv_strain
properties.description: The specific hpv strain being tested.

properties.name: intron
properties.description: Intron number targeted or included in molecular analysis. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the intron where that variant is located.

properties.name: laboratory_test
properties.description: The text term used to describe the medical testing used to diagnose, treat or further understand a patient's disease.

properties.name: loci_abnormal_count
properties.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of loci determined to be abnormal.

properties.name: loci_count
properties.description: Numeric value used to describe the number of loci tested.

properties.name: locus
properties.description: The position of a gene or a chromosomal marker on a chromosome; also, a stretch of DNA at a particular place on a particular chromosome. The use of locus is sometimes restricted to mean regions of DNA that are expressed.

properties.name: mismatch_repair_mutation
properties.description: The yes o/unknown indicator used to describe whether the mutation included in molecular testing was known to have an affect on the mismatch repair process.

properties.name: mitotic_count
properties.description: The number of mitoses identified under the microscope in tumors. The method of counting varies, according to the specific tumor examined. Usually, the mitotic count is determined based on the number of mitoses per high power field (40X) or 10 high power fields.

properties.name: mitotic_total_area
properties.description: The total area reviewed when calculating the mitotic index ratio.

properties.name: molecular_analysis_method
properties.description: The text term used to describe the method used for molecular analysis.

properties.name: molecular_consequence
properties.description: The text term used to describe the molecular consequence of genetic variation.

properties.name: mutation_codon
properties.description: The codon where a change in the nucleotide sequence is occurring and causing an error.

properties.name: pathogenicity
properties.description: The text used to describe a variant's level of involvement in the cause of the patient's disease according to the standards outlined by the American College of Medical Genetics and Genomics (ACMG).

properties.name: ploidy
properties.description: Text term used to describe the number of sets of homologous chromosomes.

properties.name: second_exon
properties.description: The second exon number involved in molecular variation. If a specific genetic variant is being reported, this property can be used to capture the second exon where that variant is located. This property is typically used for a translocation where two different locations are involved in the variation.

properties.name: second_gene_symbol
properties.description: The text term used to describe a secondary gene targeted or included in molecular analysis. For rearrangements, this should represent the location of the variant.

properties.name: specialized_molecular_test
properties.description: Text term used to describe a specific test that is not covered in the list of molecular analysis methods.

properties.name: staining_intensity_scale
properties.description: The scale used by the immunohistochemistry staining rating.

properties.name: staining_intensity_value
properties.description: The degree or magnitude of staining by a dye or reagent within a microscopic specimen.

properties.name: test_analyte_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of analyte used for molecular testing.

properties.name: test_result
properties.description: The text term used to describe the result of the molecular test. If the test result was a numeric value see test_value.

properties.name: test_units
properties.description: The text term used to describe the units of the test value for a molecular test. This property is used in conjunction with test_value.

properties.name: test_value
properties.description: The text term or numeric value used to describe a specific result of a molecular test.

properties.name: test_value_range
properties.description: The range of values within which the subject's results fall.

properties.name: timepoint_category
properties.description: Category describing a specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

properties.name: transcript
properties.description: Alphanumeric value used to describe the transcript of a specific genetic variant.

properties.name: variant_origin
properties.description: The text term used to describe the biological origin of a specific genetic variant.

properties.name: variant_type
properties.description: The text term used to describe the type of genetic variation.

properties.name: zygosity
properties.description: The text term used to describe the zygosity of a specific genetic variant.

properties.description: Unique identifiers for records in the 'follow_up' table that relate via this foreign key to records in this 'molecular_test' table.

properties.description: A unique identifier for records in this 'molecular_test' table.
